findings.title: Test Case failed of passing _jobber address
findings.description: The require(_jobber != 0) condition can be bypassed when any value other than zero is entered, including '5'. This is because the comparison does not properly check if the _jobber address is zero.

findings.title: Smart Contract constructor doesn't check if _jobber is same as of employer (msg.sender) or Owner.
findings.description: The smart contract's constructor does not verify that the _jobber address is different from the employer (msg.sender) or the owner, allowing an employer to pay themselves multiple times, which is unethical.

findings.title: Use pause() Function or Pausable library
findings.description: Using pause() function or Pausable library can help stop contract functionalities if needed.

findings.title: Unnecessary State Update
findings.description: Updating the state of contractIsPaid to true when it's already true, resulting in wasted gas.

findings.title: Solidity version must be fixed (Always use latest Version)
findings.description: The Solidity version used in the contract is outdated and should be updated to the latest version.

findings.title: Inconsistent Naming Conventions and Function Grouping
findings.description: The contract does not follow Solidity naming conventions to declare variable names, and the order of function grouping is incorrect.

findings.title: Also Use Events to listen in Dapp.
findings.description: Use events to listen in DApp for better functionality and user experience.
